body: I just had a look at the API. It looks like rclone could do blob or file storage. Which of those is more interesting to you?

Actually both

We use https://trac.cyberduck.io/wiki/help/en/howto/cli for blobs so kind of covered there. 

Azure Files will be more interesting to us.

rename.from: Any plans to add Azure Storage Accounts?

body: I've re-purposed this issue to be just about azure files, since rclone now implements azure blob storage.

It would be great if this could be implemented so that we can do the (basic) equivalent of [Azure File Sync](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/files/storage-sync-files-planning) in a Linux environment.
I'll just note that Microsoft appear to have made a new go SDK for files: https://github.com/Azure/azure-storage-file-go which looks comprehensive and has a low level and a high level interface.
Hi, are there any updates for the support of MS azure file share? Thanks~
I haven't had time to work on this. Anyone want to have a go?

> @ncw @mohitarora
> Aint this implemented by https://rclone.org/azureblob ?

No its a different thing "azure files"

I did make a start at a backend but I didn't get past the skeleton.

I think it is perfectly possible if someone would like to work on it.
It would be very helpful to add azure files. If I'm not mistaking, azure files is preferred over azure blobs for people using kubernetes in azure due to some functionalities.
If someone's company would like to sponsor this that would help move it up the TODO list! Drop me an email nick@craig-wood.com if interested.
Hi, are there any updates for the support of Azure file share? Thanks !
any update to this? azcopy is terrible.
I don't think anyone is working on this @daymanbpi - do you want to? Or do you want to sponsor the work?
